name: Kirbinator
description: Stochastic audio processor that continuously records audio and plays back pitched, reversed, and panned slices based on probabilities triggered by Mark and Trigger inputs. Features random seed control and mutation for repeatable/evolving patterns.

specifications.name: Buffer size
specifications.description: The maximum size of the audio buffer.

parameters.name: Pitch up
parameters.description: The probability that playback will be pitched up.

parameters.name: Pitch down
parameters.description: The probability that playback will be pitched down.

parameters.name: Fifths
parameters.description: The probability that, if playback is pitched up or down, it will be by a perfect fifth; otherwise, it will be by an octave.

parameters.name: Reverse
parameters.description: The probability that playback will be reversed.

parameters.name: Glide
parameters.description: The probability that a glide will be applied to any pitch change.

parameters.name: Stutter
parameters.description: The probability that playback of the new slice will be stuttered, that is, that the initial part of the playback will be repeated.

parameters.name: Triplet
parameters.description: If 'Metrical' stutter has been selected, the probability that a stutter will be a triplet division, rather than a division by a power of 2.

parameters.name: Play
parameters.description: The probability that playback will actually happen; otherwise, playback stops.

parameters.name: Glide control
parameters.description: Sets whether a single glide time is used, or independent times for up and down glides.

parameters.name: Glide
parameters.description: The time of the glide time to apply, if a glide is activated by the probability.

parameters.name: Glide up
parameters.description: The glide up time, if the control is independent.

parameters.name: Glide down
parameters.description: The glide down time, if the control is independent.

parameters.name: Through zero
parameters.description: Whether glides are allowed when the playback direction reverses. Such glides can produce a very strong tape stop effect.

parameters.name: Min stutter
parameters.description: If a stutter is activated, the minimum number of restarts.

parameters.name: Max stutter
parameters.description: If a stutter is activated, the maximum number of restarts.

parameters.name: Min jump
parameters.description: The minimum number of slices away from the current record position to jump.

parameters.name: Max jump
parameters.description: The maximum number of slices away from the current record position to jump.

parameters.name: Stutter
parameters.description: Sets whether stutter is 'Free' (unconstrained apart from by the minimum and maximum parameters), or 'Metrical' (restricted to powers of 2 and 3, according to the Triplet probability).

parameters.name: Pitch offset
parameters.description: Applies a constant pitch change to playback, added to any probabilistic pitch change.

parameters.name: Glide offset
parameters.description: Applies a constant glide time, added to any probabilistic glide.

parameters.name: Fade
parameters.description: Sets the fade in/out time for slice playback.

parameters.name: Random seed
parameters.description: If non-zero, a random seed to apply.

parameters.name: Apply seed
parameters.description: Applies the random seed when the parameter goes from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: Mutate
parameters.description: The degree of mutation from the given random seed to the next.

parameters.name: Trigger hold time
parameters.description: Sets the time after which releasing the trigger input will be treated as a stop trigger.

parameters.name: Buffer size
parameters.description: The audio buffer size (the maximum is set by the algorithm specifications).

parameters.name: Feedback
parameters.description: The amount by which existing buffer content is attenuated on each recording pass. -24dB is treated as –∞dB i.e. the previous content is completely replaced.

parameters.name: Detect
parameters.description: Enables transient detection. See above.

parameters.name: Sensitivity
parameters.description: The transient detection sensitivity.

parameters.name: Dry gain
parameters.description: The level of the input signal passed through to the output.

parameters.name: Effect gain
parameters.description: The output level of the Kirbinator effect.

parameters.name: Pan mean
parameters.description: The average pan position of slice playback.

parameters.name: Pan deviation
parameters.description: The amount of random deviation away from the average pan position, calculated for each trigger.

parameters.name: Left/mono input
parameters.description: The left or mono audio input.

parameters.name: Right input
parameters.description: The right audio input.

parameters.name: Left/mono output
parameters.description: The left or mono audio output.

parameters.name: Right output
parameters.description: The right audio output.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

parameters.name: Mark input
parameters.description: The bus to use as the Mark signal.

parameters.name: Trigger input
parameters.description: The bus to use as the Trigger signal.

parameters.name: Stop input
parameters.description: A trigger on this bus causes the currently playing slice to stop.

parameters.name: Pitch offset input
parameters.description: A 1V/octave pitch CV on this bus is added to the 'Pitch offset' parameter.
